title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, objectives, and requirements for the Parallel Programming Lab environment. Target audience: Students learning parallel programming concepts. Learning Objectives: To provide hands-on coding challenges, visualizations, and resources to understand and practice parallel programming concepts. Programming Languages and Concepts to be covered: C++ (OpenMP), Python (NumPy, Dask, multiprocessing), MPI (Message Passing Interface) with additional focus on synchronization, load balancing, and scaling techniques. User Experience: An interactive, engaging, and intuitive platform that facilitates the learning process through tutorials, examples, and quizzes. To improve accessibility, consider adding audio/video tutorials for visually impaired students, captions for hearing-impaired students, and keyboard navigation support. Ensure compatibility with various platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux) and web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari). For better user engagement, incorporate gamification elements such as points, leaderboards, and badges. To optimize performance and scalability, consider using cloud-based solutions like AWS or Azure. To ensure security, follow best practices for data protection and implement necessary security measures. Update the UI/UX design to create a modern and attractive interface. To facilitate collaboration, incorporate discussion forums and peer review features.
